page.title: 06FARMING: STOCK REARING
page.content: Frank Hampton works from Wales to Northampton for a farming cooperative based at Stratford-on-Avon. He travels around farms collecting cattle and then returns to the larriage. The cattle are sorted out for quality and then despatched for killing or further rearing. Tom Wellon is the manager of the Cheltenham and District Meat Company and his son is the director. In Apperley Richard Wellon cuts and sells meat to the villagers. Live cattle brought from Wales is slaughtered for meat and transported in lorries and vans.
